content: I confirm and want to proceed

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a confirmation message for proceeding with data management actions. It is typically displayed in a checkbox label or as a button text, prompting the user to agree to terms before taking action. In this context, it appears on a restore backup form and a backup list view.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Təsdiqləyirəm və davam etmək istəyirəm' is a literal translation and sounds overly formal and verbose for a confirmation button. A more natural and concise translation would better suit the context.

The Greek translation 'Επιβεβαίωση και συνέχιση' translates to 'Confirmation and continuation'. While not strictly incorrect, it doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'I confirm and want to proceed'. It sounds more formal and less user-friendly than the original.

The translation '確認して、進む' (Kakunin shite, susumu) is a literal translation and doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'I confirm and want to proceed.' It's more like 'Confirm and proceed.'  It lacks the sense of affirmation or agreement implied by 'I confirm'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 検討して、同意します (Kentou shite, doui shimasu) - 'I have considered and agree' or 同意して、進めます (Doui shite, susumemasu) - 'I agree and proceed'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation '확인하고 진행하겠습니다' (hwak-in-ha-go jin-hae-get-seum-ni-da) literally translates to 'I will confirm and proceed'. While understandable, 'I confirm and want to proceed' carries a sense of active consent which is not fully captured. A more direct translation emphasizing agreement might be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider '동의하고 진행하겠습니다' (dong-ui-ha-go jin-hae-get-seum-ni-da) which translates to 'I agree and will proceed', or '동의하고 계속 진행하겠습니다' (dong-ui-ha-go gye-soek jin-hae-get-seum-ni-da) for 'I agree and will continue proceeding'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ຂ້ອຍຢືນຢັນແລະຕ້ອງການດໍາເນີນການ' is a literal translation but might sound a bit formal or stiff in this context. A more natural phrasing would be better. 'I confirm and want to proceed' implies agreement and readiness to continue.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural phrasing like 'ຕົກລົງແລະດໍາເນີນການຕໍ່ໄປ' (Totglong lae damnoen kan to pai) which means 'Agree and proceed'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'Agreez și doresc să continui' is a bit formal and lengthy for a confirmation button. A more natural and concise translation would be better.
The translation includes 'și', which can be stylistically heavy for a button label.  Consider removing it to make the phrase more direct and scannable.

The translation "මම තහවුරු කරමි. ඉදිරියට යාමට වුවමනාය." is a literal and somewhat awkward translation of 'I confirm and want to proceed'. While technically correct, it doesn't flow naturally in Sinhala for a user interface element. It conveys confirmation and necessity, but the 'want to' aspect is lost.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural and user-friendly translation like "මා අනුමත කරමි, ඉදිරියට යන්නට කැමතියි" (Ma anumatha karami, idiriyata yannaṭa kamatiyi) or a simpler "අනුමත කරන්න, ඉදිරියට යන්න" (Anumatha karanne, idiriyata yanna) depending on the desired formality.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "我确认并继续" is understandable, it's not the most natural or idiomatic translation of "I confirm and want to proceed." It sounds slightly formal and stiff.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural phrasing like "我已确认并继续" (Wǒ yǐ quèrán bìng jìxù) or "确认并继续" (Quèrán bìng jìxù) depending on the overall tone of the settings page.
